intro: Nonatelia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Nonatelia amazonica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
